FuncDef:
The memory-usage reliability command sets thresholds for memory usage reliability.
The undo memory-usage reliability command restores the default thresholds for memory usage reliability.
The threshold value of notice is 85. The threshold value of overload is 90.
CLIs: undo memory-usage reliability [ notice-threshold <notice-threshold-value> overload-threshold <overload-threshold-value> ] [ slot <slotId> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Memory reliability overload threshold.
The value is an integer that ranges from 86 to 100.

Memory reliability notice threshold.
The value is an integer that ranges from 85 to 99.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
After enabling memory usage reliability, run the memory-usage reliability command to set thresholds for memory usage reliability on a board. If the memory usage of the board exceeds the threshold (level-1 overload threshold) specified by notice-threshold notice-threshold-value, the system notifies the top 3 components of the process with the highest memory usage. If the memory usage of the board exceeds the threshold (level-2 overload threshold) specified by overload-threshold overload-threshold-value, the system notifies the process with the highest memory usage. If the process is PROTO1, the system resets PROTO1.
Prerequisites
Memory usage reliability has been enabled using the memory-usage reliability switch on command.
